content.description:
Wide compression that slowly narrows.



Take the blue line  trail, the trail goes up , then down, continue 100m after it goes up, the boulder is 20meters off the trail to the right as you go up, hidden in a creek. There used to be logs to prevent  pads from getting soaked. 

49°18'30.1"N 122°49'33.2"W

Fun simple climb. easier on left or right side, harder in the middle. WARNING moss extremely slippery in the middle. Lots of nice holds, not too many little crimps.



Parking at AspenWood elementary, across the street you'll find "upper backyard trail" (on TrailForks). walk on it for about 5 mins, that will take you to forest park way, cross road and continue up trail for about 5 more mins. After 5 mins you'll see a bridge going to the right. cross bridge and immediately take a left and go through the bushes. you'll be at the boulder, just walk down to the side and start climbing!

Bring a crash pad!

Starting low, need a possible heel hook and then some crimpy holds before slab and more slabs. Need a spotter. Right on IMBY trail. 50 m from trail head. this picture is older and the choss for the route is off 

Look on Trail Forks app. Locate IMBY trail. Take the trail from start and it is within a minute or two on the left side of the trail

Easier route on the left, harder route to the right with a nice sloper and decent footholds. Watch out for wet moss, especially on the right route!



Walk up stoneridge lane, turn right at diamond crescent, then turn left and walk up wall bypass trail until you enter a plateau, on your right past the creek is the boulder. You can cross the creek with some logs. coordinates are 49.307720°, -122.819453°

Crash pad and spotter recommended.

Several options. Rockwell, great small to moderate sized crimps to traverse the wall about 15-20ft traverse. 

The rock face up has small crimps and V4+ or more up. 

Walk up Randy’s trail, up above blue line about 150 m will hit the IMBY crosstrail. Go left and stay on Randy’s trail. Walk 10 m and the rock face/ boulder is on the right.

Pyradimal based rock. Good foot holds and hand holds up to 1/2 way up then slab with small crimpy holds on a moderately narrow ledge  Head along Randy’s trail, turn right on blue line trail and about 100 m in will see a trail to the left . Follow up for about 300 m and boulder on the right nullnull

Boulder sitting in shaded area. Nice holds and some tougher smaller slants 

Walk 200-300 m up Randy’s mtn bike trail, 50 m before the Blue Line/ Randy’s trail junction the boulder is on your left

Pretty easy climb with some crimps and horizontal cracks. Watch out for wet moss!



Starting from the roundabout by Heritage Woods Secondary School, head to the right up the Bert Flinn Loop Trail. Walk for around 400m and then turn left onto Jump Track. Walk for a minute or two and the boulder will be on your right. (On the backside of Trust Your Feet)

49.300960°,  -122.845107°

Multiple options. Middle is the hardest and the ones on the side are easier. Very few handholds in the middle. Some crimps at the top and scarce footholds at the start.



Starting from the roundabout by Heritage Woods Secondary School, head to the right up the Bert Flinn Loop Trail. Walk for around 400m and then turn left onto Jump Track. Walk for a minute or two and the boulder will be on your right.

49.300960°,  -122.845107°
